name: Catenae-dev
tagline: A machine-corrected version of the Catenae Graecorum Patrum in Novum Testamentum.
body:
#Welcome to **catenae-dev**!

##About
This repository hosts digital versions of the _Catenae Graecorum Patrum in Novum Testamentum_.

These XML files were produced by data entry company [DDD](http://www.digitaldividedata.org/), who OCR'd, corrected and encoded each volume of the _Catenae_ in accordance with the latest [EpiDoc](http://sourceforge.net/p/epidoc/wiki/Home/) standards.
While adequate, more can and should be done to improve the XML (the -dev(elopment) suffix indicates the repository is open to improvement).

##Volumes

* [Vol. 1: _In Evangelia S. Matthaei et S. Marci_](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/catenae-dev/blob/master/catenae_1.xml) (1844) Ed. John Anthony Cramer. Oxonii: E Typographeo Academico.
* [Vol. 2: _In Evangelia S. Lucae et S. Joannis_](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/catenae-dev/blob/master/catenae_2.xml) (1844) Ed. John Anthony Cramer. Oxonii: E Typographeo Academico.
* Vol. 3: _In Acta SS. Apostolorum_ (1844) Ed. John Anthony Cramer. Oxonii: E Typographeo Academico.
* [Vol. 4: _In Epistolam S. Pauli ad Romanos_](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/catenae-dev/blob/master/catenae_4.xml) (1844) Ed. John Anthony Cramer. Oxonii: E Typographeo Academico.
* [Vol. 5: _In Epistolas S. Pauli ad Corinthios_](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/catenae-dev/blob/master/catenae_5.xml) (1844) Ed. John Anthony Cramer. Oxonii: E Typographeo Academico.
* [Vol. 6: _In Epistolas S. Pauli ad Galatas, Ephesios, Philippenses, Colossenses, Thessalonicenses_](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/catenae-dev/blob/master/catenae_6.xml) (1844) Ed. John Anthony Cramer. Oxonii: E Typographeo Academico.
* [Vol. 7: _In Epistolas S. Pauli ad Timotheum, Titum, Philemona, et ad Hebraeos_](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/catenae-dev/blob/master/catenae_7.xml) (1844) Ed. John Anthony Cramer. Oxonii: E Typographeo Academico.
* Vol. 8: _In Epistolas Catholicas et Apocalypsin_ (1844) Ed. John Anthony Cramer. Oxonii: E Typographeo Academico.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
